scenario:
Claravine, a data standards company, announced a successful partnership with Colgate-Palmolive, a global consumer products leader. Colgate implemented Claravine's Data Standards Cloud to achieve nearly 100% taxonomy compliance, improving data harmony and operational efficiency across its global marketing campaigns. 

Prior to implementation, Colgate faced challenges maintaining consistency across its numerous marketing campaigns due to collaboration from multiple agencies and teams that interpreted brand taxonomy independently. This resulted in a lack of brand taxonomy compliance, time-consuming data cleanup, inaccurate full-funnel campaign reporting, and reporting delays.

Key results of the partnership include:

- Unified historical data: Claravine enabled the cleanup and alignment of legacy data, revitalizing previously "unmeasurable" campaigns.
- Customizable global taxonomy: A centralized platform with regional customization capabilities allowed for seamless data collection and improved team collaboration.
- Taxonomy compliance increased from 20% to nearly 100%.
- Automated data flows: Bi-directional integrations automated data flow, minimizing manual intervention and ensuring real-time validation.

Claravine's Data Standards Cloud and its bi-directional integrations with Google Display & Video 360 and Campaign Manager 360 enabled Colgate to maintain its existing media execution process, establish global governance and standards, and achieve remarkable results.
